Coffee & Viz:

Serious Gaming with Tangible Landscape

Center for Geospatial Analytics

Brendan Harmon & Anna Petrasova


Serious gaming


An approach to problem solving that is:

  • engaging
  • motivating
  • stimulates thinking about thinking
  • fun!

Science as problem solving


The scientific method as a iterative problem solving process

  • observe
  • hypothesize
  • test
  • ...

Scientific gaming


To make scientific problem solving a game we need:

  • goals
  • rules
  • interactivity
  • challenging tasks
  • scores

Challenges to scientific gaming


With computers we can scientifically model complex problems.

Interacting with computers, however, can be:

  • unintuitive
  • inaccessible
  • hard-to-learn
  • decontextualized
  • unsituated
  • uncollaborative

Developing games with

Tangible Landscape

A tangible user interface powered by open source GIS

Concept

Coupling a digital and physical model of a landscape


Physically manifesting digital data so that you can intuitively feel and shape it with your hands

Near real-time interaction

Sculping topography to change a stream

How-it-works

Intuitive science with Tangible Landscape


Tangible Landscape is designed to make scientific data, models, and simulations:

  • easy to interact with
  • easy to explore and understand
  • engaging and fun

Serious gaming with Tangible Landscape


Therefore we should be able to make serious games that are:

  • driven by interactive scientific models
  • richly analytical
  • fun, engaging, and easy to play

Goals


Our goals are to enhance:

  • learning
  • spatial thinking
  • decision making
  • consensus building
